problem_statement: Develop a rigorous unit testing suite for a restaurant bill-splitting utility in JavaScript. The objective is to verify mathematical accuracy down to the cent, ensuring the system handles floating-point rounding errors and remains perfectly accountable for taxes and tips across uneven party sizes.
FAIL_TO_PASS: Optimization Tests > should handle floating-point numPeople by flooring
Optimization Tests > should handle NaN numPeople gracefully
Optimization Tests > should handle Infinity numPeople gracefully
Optimization Tests > should handle undefined numPeople gracefully
Optimization Tests > should handle negative tax by treating as 0
Optimization Tests > should handle negative tip by treating as 0
Optimization Tests > should handle negative total gracefully
PASS_TO_PASS: Requirement 1: Penny-Perfect Reconciliation > should split $100.00 bill 3 ways with 10% tax and 15% tip to precisely 126.50
Requirement 1: Penny-Perfect Reconciliation > should maintain penny-perfect accuracy for 7-person split
Requirement 1: Penny-Perfect Reconciliation > should handle complex percentage calculations without deviation
Requirement 1: Penny-Perfect Reconciliation > should be penny-perfect for prime number party sizes
Requirement 2: Remainder Allocation Check > should assign remainder penny exclusively to result[0] for 10/3 split
Requirement 2: Remainder Allocation Check > should not distribute remainder as fractions of a cent
Requirement 2: Remainder Allocation Check > should assign 2 cent remainder to lead payer for 5-way split of $10.02
Requirement 2: Remainder Allocation Check > should verify lead payer always has highest or equal amount
Requirement 2: Remainder Allocation Check > should handle remainder of 0 correctly (even split)
Requirement 3: Percentage Boundary Validation > should handle 0% tax correctly
Requirement 3: Percentage Boundary Validation > should handle 0% tip correctly
Requirement 3: Percentage Boundary Validation > should handle both 0% tax and 0% tip correctly
Requirement 3: Percentage Boundary Validation > should not return NaN for any zero percentage scenario
Requirement 3: Percentage Boundary Validation > should handle 100% tax and 100% tip correctly
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should return empty array for 0 people
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should return empty array for -1 people
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should return empty array for large negative numbers
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should not throw an error for invalid party sizes
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should handle edge case of 1 person correctly
Requirement 4: Invalid Input Resilience > should handle very large party size
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should avoid floating-point leakage for $19.99
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should avoid floating-point leakage for $4.32
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should handle problematic floating-point numbers correctly
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should handle high-volume batch of varying amounts
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should prevent 0.1 + 0.2 !== 0.3 type errors
Requirement 5: Floating-Point Error Prevention > should handle amounts like $9.99 correctly
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should split $60.00 for 4 people with 0% tax/tip to exactly 15.00 each
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should return correct array length for party size
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should sum to exactly the original amount with no tax/tip
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should handle other even splits correctly
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should handle $80 for 4 people correctly
Requirement 6: Happy Path > should handle $120 for 6 people correctly
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should split $0.05 among 3 people with first paying 0.03 and others 0.01
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should verify total of 0.05 split equals 0.05
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should handle $0.01 split among 3 people correctly
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should handle $0.02 split among 3 people correctly
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should handle $0.04 split among 3 people correctly
Requirement 7: Lead Payer Logic > should handle $0.07 split among 3 people correctly
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should execute early return branch for zero people
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should execute early return branch for negative people
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should execute main calculation path
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should execute remainder allocation when remainder exists
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should execute path where no remainder exists
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover tax percentage calculation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover tip percentage calculation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover combined tax and tip calculation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover cents to dollars conversion
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover Array.fill operation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover Array.map operation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover Math.round in totalCents calculation
Requirement 8: Code Coverage > should cover Math.floor in perPersonCents calculation
Optimization Tests > should handle string input for total
Integration Tests > should handle real-world restaurant scenario
Integration Tests > should handle large party scenario
Integration Tests > should handle very small bill scenario
Integration Tests > should handle birthday dinner scenario
